meanings.definition: A small group of specially trained soldiers.
meanings.sent1: The commandos stealthily approached the enemy base.
meanings.sent2: The commandos were sent on a dangerous mission behind enemy lines.
meanings.sent3: The commandos decided to have a surprise party for their captain.
meanings.sent4: The commandos were like a pack of wolves, moving swiftly and silently.
meanings.sent5: The image of the commandos in their camouflaged uniforms stayed with me.

meanings.definition: To order or direct with authority.
meanings.sent1: The general will commandos the troops to advance.
meanings.sent2: She commandosed her team to complete the mission before sunset.
meanings.sent3: The teacher commandosed the students to finish their homework by Friday.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a commanding tone as he commandosed the group to attention.
meanings.sent5: The conductor commandosed the orchestra with precise movements.
